com.cards
Class Card<S extends Suit<S>,R extends Rank<R>>

java.lang.Object
  com.cards.Card<S,R>
Type Parameters:
S - an implementation of the Suit interface
R - an implementation of the Rank interface
Direct Known Subclasses:
PokerCard
public abstract class Card<S extends Suit<S>,R extends Rank<R>>
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates the notion of a playing card, extendible to multiple implementations. Playing cards have two properties, suit and rank. A Card's rank must be well-defined, but its suit may not be. Implementations of the Suit and Rank interfaces--most likely enumerated types--may be specified by subclasses or foregone until generic declaration.

Author:
Tor E Hagemann
See Also:
Suit, Rank

Constructor Detail

Card

protected Card()
Defines a default card. Note: the current version of this constructor generates an IllegalArgumentException, since it does not define rank. This is done to force subclasses to abide by standards of the implementation.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

Card

protected Card(S s,
               R r)
Constructs a playing card with the specified suit and rank.

Parameters:
s - the given Suit
r - the given Rank
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r is null
